title: (x) Two elegant scripts - Stuyvesant/(similar to) Palace Script, Classic Script {Patricia, Matt}
content:
Not sure, but think 'WKSD' is Styvesant ? At least that's what 'WhatTheFont' indicates :) They're wrong 99.9 percent of the time ... unlike the experts here who nail every request.

I wasn't able to get 'WhatTheFont' to read any of Sabrina's letters.

Your help will be appreciated.

Best wishes, Linda

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [titles.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20101221093942/http:/typophile.com/files/titles.gif) | 2.43 KB |
author: link

comments.content:
Yeah, the WKSD is Stuyvesant.

Whatthefont has NO idea what to do with script. It also bugs me that a lowercase i reads as two characters. However I've had a better success rate than you have. Identifont is the one that is truly useless.

Sabrina looks like Palace Script.

[http://www.identifont.com/find?font=palace+script&q=Go](http://web.archive.org/web/20101221093942/http:/www.identifont.com/find?font=palace+script&q=Go "http://www.identifont.com/find?font=palace+script&q=Go")

Clasiic Script comes pretty close to it as well, but the b is a little different.

[http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=420314](http://web.archive.org/web/20101221093942/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=420314 "http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=420314")

One more Sabrina script: [Shelley](http://web.archive.org/web/20101221093942/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=LH.457.0.2)

Patty - Identifont has often saved my bacon on text serifs.

The 'r' doesn't match Shelley - I tried that.

I've had a few successes with Identifont but more often than not it gives me a blackletter when I specifically said it's a sans. What that site is missing, IMHO, is a first step that allows you to categorize the font - i.e. serif, sans, script, calligraphic, display. It is improved in that now you can enter the letter selection you have available rather than having to click 'Not Sure' on all the Q and J questions.
